data.meta_description:
Discover the entrepreneur in you.

Listen to Tamilpreneur to learn about entrepreneurship and business from startup CEOs, road side businesses, case studies of startups in Tamil. Follow us on our Instagram channel for everyday news updates on startups, business : https://www.instagram.com/tamilpreneur/

Tamilpreneur is a critically acclaimed and top tamil entrepreneurship podcast that has got blockbuster ratings on Spotify, JioSaavn, Gaana, Apple podcast, google podcast and 20 other podcasting platforms.
data.text:
In this episode of Tamilpreneur, Rajamanohar is joining us.

Rajamanohar Somasundaram is the Founder & CEO of Aquaconnect, a full-stack aquaculture technology platform.

Around five million rural farmers and coastal communities depend on shrimp and fish aquaculture, where traditional farming practices prevent them from achieving production efficiency and disease prediction.

In 2019, He was awarded '40 UNDER 40 Ecosapien' by The New Indian Express for the promotion of sustainable aquaculture practices in Asia.

Aquaconnect has recently raised its Series B funding of $15 million led by Lok Capital.

The complete episode can be accessed at Tamilpreneur Club. Join Tamilpreneur Club - a family of 1000+ Tamil speaking entrepreneurs. You get

Radha Rengachari was born in Thanjavur and brought up in Chennai. She did her Bachelors in Bio Informatics from SASTRA University. She always wanted to start something on her own and never failed to try her hands in potential ideas. She had tried multiple things like being a yoga master, school teacher, radio jockey, voice over artist etc.. along with considerable years in the IT industry.

She has worked in product based companies like Freshworks and Zoho as a presales engineer for a few years. She identified that customers faced struggles in finding the right product and implementing them as per their needs. That's when Radha decided to start her own company to help these people.

Spikra Pvt Ltd was started in December 2018. They are currently Zoho exclusive Implementation partners with over 150+ clients and are present in 3 locations including the US. They have recently opened their 3rd office in Thanjavur and are predominantly planning to hire from the Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities.

Her family has been a pillar of support. She has always decided for herself and her family stood with her in every move. That really boosted her up and pushed her off limits.

Being confident is the key, says Radha.

She takes up one professional course every year to learn new things and to experience them. Upskilling is very important and how you merge it with your journey matters. Radha envisions to be the growth and technology partner for startups and medium sized companies in the long run.

"If you have the will, everything else will fall in place" - Radha

Premanand Sethurajan needs no introduction if you watch YouTube and love science.

Premanand is the founder of Let's Make Education Simple (LMES) Academy, which started with a YouTube channel in 2014, today has over 1.6 million subscribers and clocked a total of over 17 Crore views since its inception.

Later, he went on to start multiple ventures around education and career enablement for students with Chitti App, and PickMyCareer.

Chitti App is a learning platform for K-12 students that explains the curriculum-oriented syllabus in an entertaining and interesting manner with real-time stories and animations.

PickMyCareer helps school students to find their dream careers. Their AI-based career assessment, personalized career report, one on one expert session will help the students to find their career interest and maps them to the field that best fits their career.

In this episode of Tamilpreneur, Rajesh Kumar is joining us.

Rajesh is the Co-Founder and CEO of Kalvium. Prior to Kalvium, he co-founded Faceprep (famously known as FACE Academy)

In my honest opinion, parents and students both look for placement opportunities as a key factor before choosing a college. And in 4 years, lot of things change in the job market - whereas the college curriculum still remains the same.

Bottomline : "College doesn't prepare you for the Job Market"

Enter Kalvium. Kalvium is India's first liberal engineering program in Computer Science.

Classroom learning while building real world applications.

Guaranteed Placement at the end of 1st year in leading Global Tech Companies

Well, who knows the job market better than the employers themselves. The course curriculum is designed by top CXO's of the tech industry such as Cred, Flipkart, Ola.

They teach you skills that you make you industry ready today and future proof tomorrow. In addition, you graduate with three years of industry experience.

Beauty right !! Lets dig deep in this interview with Rajesh.

It feels so happy to see people from Tamilnadu are delivering world class products, but disappointing at the same time that no one is bringing out their stories.

Meet Prasath Prabhakaran, Sandeep Prabhakaran and Udhaya Chandran the Co-founders of Timeless Ventures.

They have built products & apps for Smallcase, Ditto Insurance, Freshworks, Chargebee, Privacy.com and much more. Building world class designs just sitting at Pallikaranai, Chennai :)

Their workplace design would definitely inspire one to think different. The founders were so polite and friendly. Sandeep Prabhakaran is also an entertainer who always keeps his team cheerful. Found him sharing a joke with one of his newly married teammate with hands on his shoulders. They have fun friday, play games together and lot of benefits for employees.

They are hiring for different roles like Senior Product Designer, Marketing Intern, Marketing Associate, & HR Interested people please send an email to hello@timeless.co

Checkout tamilpreneur club here - https://cutt.ly/WJIazW5 . COUPON CODE - PODCAST.

Just like a family doctor, let's have a family farmer"

A typical city brought up who had grown up hearing about connecting to the roots by her father. As an young entrepreneur, Archana Stalin took the lessons from her first venture and created myHarvest Farms in 2016.

myHarvest Farms is a company which delivers fresh produce and organic food directly to customers. Today they have more than 100 farmers serving more than 2800 families with their list grown from 40 items to 200 items. Building a healthy community which enjoys safe, healthy food and practices natural way of living has been the dream of Archana and team. Service to humanity has always been in her mind. She had started an NGO while in college with the sole aim of serving people. Today, she serves as a mentor to many startups and her growth as an entrepreneur in immense.

Few key learnings from her :

1. Pilot your product

2. Pivot when required

3. Necessity will help you take the next step

4. Empathize with your customer

5. Own your decision

Pilot your product(MVP)

Archana and team started with 1 farm and 18 families to pilot their model. They started small so that they can practically learn and understand their mistakes. This pilot phase helped them iterate and work constantly on their model.

Pivot when required

Covid was an unexpected bash for many and so was for myHarvest Farms. They were operating earlier in the subscription model and had to pivot to D2C model when situations demanded. "It was not us, but the local supply chain that won", says Archana.

Necessity

It will help you take the next step Started with a small terrace garden, understood the basics and decided to setup their own farm. Once they started farming, they learnt that there are seasonal vegetables and certain vegetables doesn't grow in certain areas. This urged them to travel to learn and create the ecosystem that is present today.

Empathize

Managing Supply chain was difficult in covid times. And unexpected delays were unavoidable. Being transparent with their customers had helped and Archana insists on being empathetic. Empathizing with customers and farmers has helped them earn their customers' and farmers' trust.

Own your decision

It has not been an easy thing to convince her family. But she and her husband who is her co-founder as well, had showcased strong will and continuous efforts in whatever they did. If you believe and own your choice, everybody around would respect and trust your choice. "If you build something exciting, people will want to use it" - Archana Stalin.

So, for today's Masterclass, (Drumroll) Let me welcome myself.

The masterclass is about User-research.

So I'll kill your time for a few minutes without going into the episode with the takeaways from

MacAppStudio Suresh's episode. You ask why ? Because it is important.

We don't want you to miss important things,

Youtube : https://youtu.be/MxUHrSsLH_E

Podcast : https://anchor.fm/tamilpreneur/episodes/S05E15---MacAppStudio-Suresh--Season-Finale--Tamilpreneur-Fellowship-Program--Tamil-Entrepreneurship-Podcast--Tamilpreneur-e1844jd/a-a6k8n43

Takeaways from Masterclass 1

It starts with an idea ? Wrong.

You want to startup to make money ? Wrong.

Which one is right ? Tune in :)

Alright alright,

You got only 30 seconds to pitch your idea to an investor from Sequoia or Accel or A16Z. How do you do it?

How do you find out whether people are willing to pay for your product ? By talking to them ? Just kidding.

You first ask yourself this question - "Whom to talk to for my user research"

What if you can find out all the potential users who would be willing to pay for your product. Awesome right ? I give it you in a single slide. You can get it here.

And then Just like love is in the air, tomatoes were in the air. Yup. We discussed on how Zomato would have chosen their target audience.

Once you have asked yourself the first question, I give you a few questions to your "target audience"

That's the end of it ? No.. The last few minutes will change the way you think about your startup.

If you read this far, but did not click the play button on the episode yet, the previous line was probably a bait.

Common, Tune in :)

Checkout more about us by clicking on this link : https://instabio.cc/tamilpreneurlinks

If you asked an entrepreneur " what's the one thing that you miss doing during the pandemic ?" He'd say innovation.

None of us is as smart as all of us. When you need to innovate, you need collaboration

VISA Tamizh Sangham kelvi patrukingala ?

If I told you Tamilnadu's greatest fintech startup came out of tea conversation, would you believe ?

M2P's CEO and co-founder Madhusudanan is here to tell you why you should believe and,

1. How did Kunal shah invest in his startup ?

2. How Kunal shah is paying it forward for the startup ecosystem ?

3. How it was decided to take a profitable bootstrapped startup to venture funded startup ?

4. Seed stage to Series A, B, C : how to plan ?

5. How did M2P capitalize demonetization and pandemic lockdown

6. How is M2P revolutionizing banking systems ?

7. The founder market fit Myth

8. Why M2P is investing in fintech startups like Ippo Pay ?

9. Chennai, a Fin-tech capital ? "Not at all, We are not doing enough"

Checkout all our works by clicking on this link : https://instabio.cc/tamilpreneurlinks

In this episode, we have a Visionary Mr.Kumar Vembu of Vembu brothers. Kumar Vembu is the CEO of Gofrugal technologies. In this episode,

1. What made Kumar Vembu to quit a job at Silicon Valley and come to India?

2. How did Kumar Vembu and Sridhar Vembu develop startup mentality during late 90s

3. Kumar Vembu's Employee to entrepreneur Phase

4. Flashback on telephone and internet connection in the 90s

5. Made in India, Sold in America - A Vembu brothers partnership.

6. How do you develop intrapreneurship culture in minds of your employees ?

7. How to choose between bootstrapping and raising funds for your startup ?

9. How does Kumar Vembu make his investments in startups ?

10. Made in India, For India - A Kumar Vembu Venture.

Founded in December 2016 and bagging many awards from Central Ministry, Webboombaa was co-founded by Mr. Durairaju, who faced multiple failures in his college life, but a winner of Top 30 under 30 award from Impact Weekly Magazine, and his co-founders and friends, Sarath Ravikumar and Varun Kumar. Mr. Durai is also one of the few founders who has taken an exit from his startup.

Mr. Durairaju is an Engineering Graduate from Anna University, Marketing and Operations Graduate (MBA) from Sri Sairam Group of Institutions, Artificial Intelligence Powered Marketing Graduate from IIM, Calcutta and also learnt Product Growth and Marketing from GrowthX.

He was a Business development Student Ambassador in Uniq Technologies, Co-Founder and CEO of Astute Fanfare, and now is also the Co-Founder of Brandinfluencerz. His startup Astutue Fanfare was started while he was a college student.

Want to learn more about a Startup, founded by a Marketing executive and his friends? Tap the Play Button!
